com.esri.mo2.util
Class BitArray

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.util.BitArray
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable
public class BitArray
extends Object
implements Cloneable

Manages a growable array of bits. All bit references are indexed from 0. The array grows in groups of 64 bits.

Constructor Summary
BitArray()
          creates an empty bit array
BitArray(int numBits)
          creates a bit array with an initial capacity
 
Method Summary
 void and(BitArray bits)
          performs a logical AND using another bit array.

          clears all bits in the array

          clones the bit array.

          returns true if the arrays have the same value for each bit.
 boolean get(int index)
          Returns the value of a bit in the array.
 int getNextClear()
          returns the index of the next bit that is cleared in the array.
 int getNextSet()
          returns the index of the next bit that is set in the array.

          returns the number of bits cleared in the array

and

public void and(BitArray bits)
performs a logical AND using another bit array. Both arrays must be the same size.

performs a logical OR using another bit array. Both arrays must be the same size.

equals

public boolean equals(Object obj)
returns true if the arrays have the same value for each bit. The arrays must have the same number of bits.

Overrides:
equals in class Object

clone

public Object clone()
clones the bit array. The new array will contain the same number of bits.

Overrides:
clone in class Object
Returns:
the cloned BitArray

set

public void set(int index)
sets a bit in the array. If the index exceeds the current size of the array, then the array will be enlarged appropriately.

get

public boolean get(int index)
Returns the value of a bit in the array.

Throws:
ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index exceeds size of the array

clear

public void clear(int index)
clears a bit in the array. It the index exceeds the current size of the array, then the array will be enlarged appropriately.

public int numSet()
returns the number of bits set in the array

numClear

public int numClear()
returns the number of bits cleared in the array

startSearch

public void startSearch()
resets the search index back to the beginning of the bit array

getNextSet

public int getNextSet()
returns the index of the next bit that is set in the array.

Returns:
-1 when you have reached the end of the array

getNextClear

public int getNextClear()
returns the index of the next bit that is cleared in the array.

Returns:
-1 when you have reached the end of the array

toString

public String toString()
returns a string representation of the bit array. In this implementation, the indexes of all bits that are set will be output to the string
